required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Progesterone Levels and Endometrial Compaction in Frozen-Thawed Embryo Transfer Cycles
clinical_study.official_title: The Correlation of Serum Progesterone Levels With the Degree of Endometrial Compaction on the Day of Frozen Embryo Transfer

brief_summary.textblock: This study is intended to determine whether there is a correlation between endometrial compaction and serum progesterone levels on the day of frozen embryo transfers by using transvaginal sonography for the endometrial assessment.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is planned to be conducted by prospectively evaluating approximately 200 frozen embryo transfers within 6 months in a single center. Patients planned to be included in the study are started estrodiol 6 mg / day on day2-3 of mensturation. 12 days after the start of estrogen, patients who have endometrial thickness over 7 mm are then started vaginal progesterone supplementation as per routine practice and are eventually proceeded to embryo transfer either on day 4 or 6 of progesterone supplementation. In this study investigators are intended to measure endometrial thickness transvaginally on the day of embryo transfer to accurately determine the presence of endometrial compaction, assess serum progesterone levels, evaluate any possible correlations between endometrial compaction, serum progesterone levels and pregnancy rates.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks after the last menstrual period of the patient
primary_outcome.description: Presence of at least one live fetus at the end of the 12th gestational week in patients with endometrial compaction compared to patients without endometrial compaction after frozen embryo transfer

secondary_outcome.measure: The Correlation of Serum Progesterone Levels With the Degree of Endometrial Compaction on the Day of Frozen Embryo Transfer
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On the day of frozen embryo transfer
secondary_outcome.description: endometrium compacted (became thinner) after the administration of progesterone

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6-7 weeks after the last menstrual period of the patient
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of an intrauterine gestational sac with fetal heart beat at 7th week of gestation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 weeks after the last menstrual period of the patient
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of gestational sacs compared to the number of embryos transferred
pregnancy loss after ultrasonographic detection of an intrauterine gestational sac

arm_group.description: patients undergoing frozen embryo transfer with artificial hormone replacement

intervention.description: transvaginal ultrasound performed on day of the start of progesterone supplementation and on the day of frozen embryo transfer; serum progesterone level measurement on day of frozen embryo transfer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Woman aged 20-40 years
2. Hormonal(estrogen and progesterone) frozen- thawed embryo transfer cycles
3. Having available blastocyst(s) cryopreserved by vitrification method.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Recurrent implantation failure
2. Recurrent pregnancy loss
3. Presence of uterine pathology
4. Requirement for fresh embryo(s);
5. Presence of any clinically relevant systemic disease contraindicated for assisted reproduction or pregnancy
6. Allergy history for relevant drugs
7. Body mass index of <18 or >38 kg/m2 at screening
8. Current breastfeeding or pregnancy
9. Refusal or inability to comply with the requirements of the protocol for any reason, including scheduled clinic visits and laboratory tests
10. Natural or modified natural cycles
